greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of numbers with no '0' decimal digits whose sum of digits equals n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..961 (terms n = 1..31 from Laurent Desnogues)
Project Euler, Problem 377: Sum of digits, experience 13
Tadao Takaoku, A two-level algorithm for generating multiset permutations, RIMS Kokyuroku 1644 (2009), pp. 95-109.
example: 2 and 11 are the only numbers without 0's which have digit sum 2, so a(2) = 2 + 11 = 13.
results.author: _Laurent Desnogues_ and _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 02 2012
ext: a(0)=0 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 19 2020
